channel.title: Some MS-DOS help
channel.description:
I'm writing a game.. in DOS. Yes, I know what you're thinking. "DOS sucks, code c++ or java er somethin" No. I want a challenging project.
Right now my main .cmd file is this: [spoiler=Code] [code] @echo off title Testing Program
:checkingdata if exist "data" goto checkingdataccounts if not exist "data" md "data"
:checkingdataccounts if exist "data/accounts" goto checking.settings if not exist "data/accounts" md "data/accounts"
:checking.settings if exist ".settings" goto checking.settingsfiles if not exist ".settings" md ".settings"
:checking.settingsfiles if exist ".settings/files" goto checking.install if not exist ".settings/files" md ".settings/files"
:checking.install if exist ".install" goto checking.backup if not exist ".install" md ".install"
:checking.backup if exist "backup" goto checking.install if not exist "backup" md "backup"
:.installingfiles xcopy "mget.exe" ".install" move "mget.exe" "backup" cls cd ".install" echo Installing Test File echo MGET http://www.batchfilegamescontent.elementfx.com/content/examplefile.txt test.txt >> installfiles.cmd echo Installing Security Key echo MGET http://www.batchfilegamescontent.elementfx.com/content/securitylock.txt securitylock.cfg >> installfiles.cmd echo Moving Files Around echo move "test.txt" "/VMI" call installfiles.cmd pause cls pause [/code] [/spoiler]
I'm using a program called "MGET.exe" which allows for the [code]MGET[/code] function. I want the program to be able to create ALL the files from one file. Basically I'm asking, how would I make a .cmd or .bat file download files from the internet without an external/secondary program. Also if it could be relatively short, that'd help.
EDIT: The file WILL be better organized when it's finished. That is just the alpha code.

item.dc:creator: @Gabinhash Gabinhash
item.description:
@Gabinhash wrote:

I’m writing a game… in DOS. Yes, I know what you’re thinking.
"DOS sucks, code c++ or java er somethin"
No. I want a challenging project.

Right now my main .cmd file is this:
[spoiler=Code]

@echo off
title Testing Program

:checkingdata
if exist "data" goto checkingdataccounts
if not exist "data" md "data"

:checkingdataccounts
if exist "data/accounts" goto checking.settings
if not exist "data/accounts" md "data/accounts"

:checking.settings
if exist ".settings" goto checking.settingsfiles
if not exist ".settings" md ".settings"

:checking.settingsfiles
if exist ".settings/files" goto checking.install
if not exist ".settings/files" md ".settings/files"

:checking.install
if exist ".install" goto checking.backup
if not exist ".install" md ".install"

:checking.backup
if exist "backup" goto checking.install
if not exist "backup" md "backup"

:.installingfiles
xcopy "mget.exe" ".install"
move "mget.exe" "backup"
cls
cd ".install"
echo Installing Test File
echo MGET http://www.batchfilegamescontent.elementfx.com/content/examplefile.txt test.txt >> installfiles.cmd
echo Installing Security Key
echo MGET http://www.batchfilegamescontent.elementfx.com/content/securitylock.txt securitylock.cfg >> installfiles.cmd
echo Moving Files Around
echo move "test.txt" "/VMI"
call installfiles.cmd
pause
cls
pause

[/spoiler]

I’m using a program called “MGET.exe” which allows for the MGET function.
I want the program to be able to create ALL the files from one file.
Basically I’m asking, how would I make a .cmd or .bat file download files from the internet without an external/secondary program. Also if it could be relatively short, that’d help.

EDIT: The file WILL be better organized when it’s finished. That is just the alpha code.
